hero.title: Technology made
hero.subtitle: Master technology with confidence through personalized, step-by-step guidance that feels like having a patient friend by your side.

featuresSection.title: Features
featuresSection.subtitle: These are just a few of the features offered to help you grow!

items.title: Step-by-Step Guidance
items.description: Get clear, easy-to-follow instructions for any tech question. Each step is explained in simple terms with visual cues.

items.title: Voice Support
items.description: Ask questions with your voice and have answers read aloud. Perfect for hands-free help when you need it most.

items.title: Photo Explainer
items.description: Take a photo of any cable, button, or device and get an instant explanation of what it is and how to use it.

items.title: Senior-Friendly Design
items.description: Large text, intuitive interface, and patient explanations designed specifically with seniors in mind.

items.title: Safe & Secure
items.description: Your personal information is protected with enterprise-grade security. No data shared with third parties.

items.title: Instant Answers
items.description: Get immediate help 24/7. No waiting on hold or scheduling appointments. Just ask and get answers.

popularQuestionsSection.title: Popular Questions We Help With
popularQuestionsSection.subtitle: See what other seniors are asking about

testimonialsSection.title: What Our Community Says
testimonialsSection.subtitle: Join thousands of seniors who've found tech help made simple

testimonialContent.name: Margaret K.
testimonialContent.content: Finally, someone who explains technology in a way I can understand! The step-by-step instructions helped me set up my new phone perfectly. I feel so much more confident now!

testimonialContent.name: Robert H.
testimonialContent.content: The voice feature is amazing! I can just ask my questions out loud and get clear answers. It's like having a tech-savvy grandchild available 24/7.

testimonialContent.name: Dorothy S.
testimonialContent.content: I love the photo feature! I took a picture of a confusing cable and instantly knew what it was for. This app has made me much more confident with technology.

testimonialContent.name: Frank M.
testimonialContent.content: I was so frustrated with my smart TV until I found this helper. Now I can stream shows, adjust settings, and even video chat with my grandkids!

beginner.title: Getting Started with Technology
beginner.description: Perfect for complete beginners. Learn the basics step by step.

deviceBasics.title: Device Basics
deviceBasics.description: Learn how to turn your device on and off safely
deviceBasics.content:
Turning Your Device On and Off

Every device has a power button. Let's learn how to use it safely.

For Computers:

  • ‚Ä¢ Look for a round button with a power symbol (‚èª)
  • ‚Ä¢ Press it once to turn on
  • ‚Ä¢ To turn off: Use the Start menu, then "Shut down"
  • ‚Ä¢ Never just press the power button to turn off!

For Phones/Tablets:

  • ‚Ä¢ Power button is usually on the side
  • ‚Ä¢ Press and hold for 2-3 seconds to turn on
  • ‚Ä¢ To turn off: Press and hold, then slide to power off
keyPoints: Always use proper shutdown procedures
Power button location varies by device
Never force power off unless absolutely necessary
deviceBasics.practiceExercise: Practice turning your device on and off 3 times using the proper method.
deviceBasics.animationDesc: Watch how to properly press the power button

mouseKeyboard.title: Using Mouse and Keyboard
mouseKeyboard.description: Master the basics of computer input devices
mouseKeyboard.content:
Mouse and Keyboard Basics

Mouse Basics:

  • ‚Ä¢ Left click: Select items, open programs
  • ‚Ä¢ Right click: Open menus with more options
  • ‚Ä¢ Double click: Open files and programs
  • ‚Ä¢ Scroll wheel: Move up and down on pages

Keyboard Essentials:

  • ‚Ä¢ Space bar: Add spaces between words
  • ‚Ä¢ Enter: Start a new line or confirm
  • ‚Ä¢ Backspace: Delete the letter before cursor
  • ‚Ä¢ Shift: Make capital letters
keyPoints: Left click is your main tool
Right click opens helpful menus
Practice makes perfect
mouseKeyboard.practiceExercise: Open a simple text program and type your name, then delete it using backspace.
mouseKeyboard.animationDesc: See how to click, double-click, and right-click

internetSafety.title: Internet Safety Fundamentals
internetSafety.description: Stay safe online with these essential tips
internetSafety.content:
Staying Safe Online

Warning Signs of Scams:

  • ‚Ä¢ Urgent messages asking for money
  • ‚Ä¢ Requests for passwords or personal info
  • ‚Ä¢ "You've won" messages you didn't enter
  • ‚Ä¢ Suspicious links or attachments

Safe Browsing Tips:

  • ‚Ä¢ Look for "https://" in web addresses
  • ‚Ä¢ Only download from official app stores
  • ‚Ä¢ Keep your software updated
  • ‚Ä¢ Use strong, unique passwords
keyPoints: Never give personal information to strangers
When in doubt, ask a trusted person
Legitimate companies won't ask for passwords via email
internetSafety.practiceExercise: Identify 3 warning signs of online scams from the lesson.

intermediate.title: Connecting with Family & Friends
intermediate.description: Learn to use social media, video calls, and messaging safely.

videoCalls.title: Video Calls with Family
videoCalls.description: Connect face-to-face with loved ones anywhere
videoCalls.content:
Making Video Calls

Popular Video Call Apps:

  • ‚Ä¢ FaceTime (iPhone/iPad): Built-in, very easy
  • ‚Ä¢ WhatsApp: Works on all phones
  • ‚Ä¢ Zoom: Great for group calls
  • ‚Ä¢ Skype: Works on computers and phones

Before Your Call:

  • ‚Ä¢ Check your internet connection
  • ‚Ä¢ Find good lighting (face a window)
  • ‚Ä¢ Test your camera and microphone
  • ‚Ä¢ Have the person's contact ready
keyPoints: Good lighting makes a big difference
Test your setup before important calls
Most apps work similarly once you learn one
videoCalls.practiceExercise: Make a test video call to a family member or friend.

socialMedia.title: Social Media Basics
socialMedia.description: Connect with friends and family on Facebook and other platforms
socialMedia.content:
Getting Started with Social Media

Facebook Basics:

  • ‚Ä¢ Create a profile with your real name
  • ‚Ä¢ Add a nice profile picture
  • ‚Ä¢ Send friend requests to people you know
  • ‚Ä¢ Share updates, photos, and memories

Privacy Settings:

  • ‚Ä¢ Only accept friends you actually know
  • ‚Ä¢ Set posts to "Friends only"
  • ‚Ä¢ Don't share personal information publicly
  • ‚Ä¢ Review what others can see about you
keyPoints: Privacy settings are very important
Only connect with people you know
Think before you post - it stays online
socialMedia.practiceExercise: Set up your privacy settings to "Friends only" for posts.

advanced.title: Digital Life Mastery
advanced.description: Advanced skills for confident digital living.

smartHome.title: Smart Home Devices
smartHome.description: Control your home with voice commands and apps
smartHome.content:
Smart Home Basics

Popular Smart Devices:

  • ‚Ä¢ Smart Speakers: Alexa, Google Home
  • ‚Ä¢ Smart Thermostats: Control temperature remotely
  • ‚Ä¢ Smart Lights: Dim, change colors, set schedules
  • ‚Ä¢ Smart Doorbells: See who's at the door

Getting Started:

  • ‚Ä¢ Start with one device to learn
  • ‚Ä¢ Download the device's app
  • ‚Ä¢ Follow setup instructions step by step
  • ‚Ä¢ Practice basic voice commands
keyPoints: Start simple with one device
Voice commands make life easier
Most devices have helpful apps
smartHome.practiceExercise: If you have a smart device, practice 3 different voice commands.

onlineBanking.title: Online Banking Security
onlineBanking.content:
Safe Online Banking

Security Essentials:

  • ‚Ä¢ Always type your bank's web address directly
  • ‚Ä¢ Look for the lock icon in your browser
  • ‚Ä¢ Never bank on public Wi-Fi
  • ‚Ä¢ Log out completely when finished

What You Can Do Online:

  • ‚Ä¢ Check account balances
  • ‚Ä¢ View transaction history
  • ‚Ä¢ Transfer money between accounts
  • ‚Ä¢ Pay bills electronically
keyPoints: Security is the top priority
Your bank will never ask for passwords via email
Online banking is very convenient when done safely
onlineBanking.practiceExercise: Visit your bank's website and practice logging in (don't do any transactions yet).

ourPromise.title: Our Promise to You
ourPromise.text: At Senior Tech Helper, we understand that your privacy is precious. We're committed to protecting your personal information and being completely transparent about how we use it. This policy explains everything in simple, clear language.

cookies.title: How We Use Cookies
cookies.whatAreCookiesText: Cookies are small text files that help us remember your preferences and make your experience better. Think of them like bookmarks that help us remember where you left off.
cookies.weUseCookiesForTitle: We use cookies ONLY to help you:
uses: Remember your preferences: Text size, voice settings, and accessibility options you've chosen
Keep you signed in: So you don't have to enter your password every time
Improve our help: Understanding which features are most helpful to seniors like you
cookies.whatWeDontDoTitle: What we DON'T do with cookies:

informationCollected.title: What Information We Collect
youGiveUsList: Questions you ask our AI helper
weCollectList: How you use our app (which features help most)

howWeProtect.title: How We Protect Your Information
protections: Encryption: All your data is encrypted (scrambled) so only we can read it
Secure servers: Your information is stored on protected, professional-grade servers
Limited access: Only our essential team members can access your data
Regular security checks: We constantly monitor for any security threats

sharingInformation.title: Sharing Your Information
sharingInformation.neverSell: We will NEVER sell or rent your personal information.
sharingInformation.onlyShareInSituations: We only share your information in these very limited situations:
sharingSituations: With your permission: If you specifically ask us to share something
For technical support: With trusted service providers who help us run the app (they're bound by strict privacy agreements)
If required by law: Only if we're legally required to do so

yourRights.title: Your Rights and Choices
rightsList: See what information we have about you
Ask us to correct any wrong information
Request that we delete your account and data
Turn off cookies in your browser settings
Contact us with any privacy questions
yourRights.noteDeletingCookiesText: If you delete our cookies, you'll need to set up your preferences again, and some features might not work as well.

thirdPartyServices.title: Third-Party Services
thirdPartyServices.weUseTrustedServices: We use some trusted third-party services to help provide our features:
servicesList: Google AI (Gemini): Powers our AI assistant that answers your questions
Firebase: Securely stores your account information
YouTube/Educational Sites: We may recommend helpful videos and articles
thirdPartyServices.servicesOwnPolicies: These services have their own privacy policies, and we only share the minimum information needed for them to work.

changesToPolicy.title: Changes to This Policy
changesToPolicy.text: If we need to update this privacy policy, we'll notify you by email and show a notice in the app. We'll always explain what's changing and why in simple, clear language.

contactUs.title: Contact Us
contactUs.questions: Have questions about your privacy or this policy? The TechStep team is here to help!

footer.thankYou: Thank you for trusting TechStep with your information. We're committed to keeping it safe and using it only to help you succeed with technology.
